result.execSummary:
The defendant Camille M Carson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 86 days is granted. TIME SERVED.
-Remaining credit of 9 days to be applied to costs. Costs deemed paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camille M Carson

10:50 AM Defendant Camille M Carson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Camille M Carson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:
77 DAYS Waukesha County Jail
86 Days Credit 
TIME SERVED
	
Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
9 days credit to be used toward fine fee in this matter 
PAID IN FULL
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
